column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE cautiously approaches a little shipwreck, crashed on rocks poking out of the ocean.
column5: Narrator : CAPITAINE cautiously approaches a little shipwreck that crashed on some pointy rocks poking out of the ocean.
column14: Narrator : NOMBATEAU faces the wreck of an immense vessel that was probably crewed by dozens of men in its time.

column5: Narrator : The mast of the boat, on the other hand, is still intact.

column15: Narrator : CAPITAINE finds a hay bed to spend the night on.
column16: PlayerSpeak : The hold is so deep that we can’t see the bottom of it.
PlayerSpeak : I can’t go down without a rope.

column3: Narrator : The ship is too small to sleep into.
column4: Narrator : CAPITAINE finds a hay bed to spend the night on.

column7: Narrator : The ship is too small to sleep into.
column8: Narrator : CAPITAINE finds a hay bed to spend the night on.

column10: Narrator : The mast is very slippery. CAPITAINE will have to climb carefully.

column1: Narrator : The interior of the boat is pitch black, CAPITAINE cannot see half a meter away.
column12: Narrator : While climbing, CAPITAINE slips on the humid wood and falls down.

column2: PlayerSpeak : I wish I had a lantern...

column1: PlayerSpeak : Let’s see what treasures this ship’s hiding!

column11: PlayerSpeak : I don’t have a key...

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE enters the wreck, hoping its crew left something of use before fleeing the ship.

column9: Narrator : The room is richly decorated and filled with books. The ship must have been attacked by pirates.
Narrator : CAPITAINE sees a beautiful bed, surrounded by staircases.

column3: Narrator : Further in the ship, a beautiful wooden door with intricate carvings. This must be an officer’s room.

column10: Narrator : The Captain finds a confortable bed in which an officer probably slept in.
column17: Narrator : Among the scientific guides and adventure novels, a logbook attracts CAPITAINE ‘s attention.

column11: Narrator : In the opposite wall, CAPITAINE spots a weapon rack in perfect condition.
column12: Narrator : CAPITAINE doesn’t find anything more than a chest, filled with miscellaneous objects.
column13: Narrator : CAPITAINE opens the crew's pantry.
column17: Narrator : It’s a sort of compilation of all saying about NOMTRESOR

column14: Narrator : Novels, journals, guides and logbooks do not interess CAPITAINE one bit.
column17: Narrator : Nothing CAPITAINE doesn’t know, apart from one word, repeated in almost every page.

column14: Narrator : A recently writen note on a pad seems to refer to NOMTRESOR
column15: Narrator : Nothing but cheap romantic novels and obsure scientific studies.
column16: Narrator : All the writings have been erased by humidity and time. Nothing to read here.
column17: Narrator : « FORMULA » is apparently tightly connected to the treasure.

column3: PlayerSpeak : Something to defend ourselves with
column4: PlayerSpeak : Dressed and set for the winter
column6: PlayerSpeak : It looks like diaries, about NOMTRESOR. It’s just goofy calculations and contradicting paths.

column2: PlayerSpeak : This is gonna feed us for a few days
column6: PlayerSpeak : The first phrase of the diary seems noteworthy, it reads :

column1: PlayerSpeak : The view is breathtaking from here!

column4: PlayerSpeak : Sadly, I don’t have any spyglass
